item.title: Fortnite: How to Get Sabrina Carpenter
item.description:
Sabrina Carpenter has been announced as the artist featured in Fortnite Festival Season 8, following from Hatsune Miku in Season 7. As such, fans might be extremely excited to see Sabrina make her way to Fortnite so that they can sing some tunes in Fortnite Festival or play a match of Fortnite Battle Royale as their favorite pop artist while enjoying some of her songs as Jam Tracks.

It's time to ready up with an espresso and say please please please to get a Victory Royale with Sabrina Carpenter in Fortnite , which debuts with Fortnite Festival Season 8 for a set of Sabrina Carpenter outfits, related cosmetics, and Jam Tracks.

The Sabrina Carpenter Music Pass is available through June 17, 3:30 AM ET.

How to Get Sabrina Carpenter in Fortnite

Sabrina Carpenter has three separate outfits in Fortnite , and if players want to claim the Sabrina Carpenter main outfit, then they will need to own the Music Pass (Season 8) and reach Level 4 5. Sabrina Carpenter is the final reward for the Season 8 Music Pass, which can be purchased for 1,400 V-Bucks, or $11.99 as part of the Fortnite Crew , which also grants access to the LEGO Pass and the Battle Pass.

If players purchase the Season 8 Music Pass, then they can get the Babydoll Sabrina outfit for free , which is included with the pass, and features Sabrina Carpenter in a yellow dress. This is the first skin players can get themselves, and the final one is in the Item Shop.

Players can also get Tour-Ready Sabrina Carpenter for 1,500 V-Bucks in the Fortnite Item Shop . The outfit itself is reactive, and comes with two styles: pink or blue. If players want more Sabrina Carpenter cosmetics, then they can purchase a 6-item bundle for 2,300 V-Bucks, which comes with the following:

Item Name

Item Type

Item Cost

Tour-Ready Sabrina Carpenter

Outfit

1,500 V-Bucks

Tour-Ready Sabrina Carpenter

LEGO Style

Comes with Tour-Ready Sabrina Carpenter

SC Heart Purse

Back Bling

400 V-Bucks

Cute Cutout

Contrail

600 V-Bucks

Sabrina's Mic

Microphone

800 V-Bucks

Please Please Please

Jam Track

500 V-Bucks

Tour-Ready Sabrina Carpenter will leave the Item Shop on June 1, 8 PM ET.

All Sabrina Carpenter Jam Tracks

Sabrina Carpenter has a few songs added to the collection with Fortnite Festival Season 8, and here are all of her tracks and how to get them:

Jam Track

How to Get

Juno

Reach Level 2 in Music Pass Season 8

Nonsense

Reach Level 45 in Music Pass Season 8

Espresso

500 V-Bucks in the Item Shop

Please Please Please

500 V-Bucks in the Item Shop

Feather

500 V-Bucks in the Item Shop

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games Where You Have Super Strength, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Play as an agent with superpowers in Crackdown 3, using super strength to take down crime syndicate.
  • In Marvel's Spider-Man 2, utilize super strength as Spider-Man to lift vehicles and smash through walls.
  • Saints Row 4 offers crazy open-world gameplay with super strength, allowing the player to pull off insane moves.

There are many types of open-world games; sandbox survival games, free-form role-playing games, and space exploration games, for example. And there are a great many cross-genre open-world games as well, which take gameplay features from other genres and meld them into a unified whole.

Many games share similar gameplay mechanics, but there are titles that break the mold in some way. This could be the setting, the story, the timeframe the game takes place in, etc. Then there are the games that mix things up by changing how the player acts, and the skills and attributes they have, such as super strength.

8 Crackdown 3

Play As An Agent With Superpowers

Your comment has not been saved

Crackdown 3
Action
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 63 /100 Critics Rec: 18%
Released
February 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Sumo Digital
Platform(s)
Xbox One X, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

Crackdown 3 is an open-world action game, with the player taking on the role of an agent with superpowers, including super strength. The task: taking down a crime syndicate in any way possible. The action is frantic and quite frankly excessive at times, but it is extremely entertaining nonetheless.

The player has a number of superpowers, and super strength is one of them. They can use this additional strength to pick up cars and throw them, smash their way through walls, and make mincemeat out of enemies in combat. Crackdown 3 is a really fun game, and worthy of a place on this list.

7 Infamous 2

Continues The Story Of The First Game

Your comment has not been saved

inFAMOUS 2
8 /10
8 /10
Released
June 7, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3
Powered by

Infamous 2 continues the story of Cole MacGrath, with his ability to manipulate electrical power. In the first game, Cole barely survived at the end, but he is now back and ready to face a new threat in the form of The Beast. The open-world map is pretty large, and an improvement over the first game.

Using his super strength and the special Amp weapon, Cole can dish out some truly devastating damage in melee combat. His punches are so powerful that he can launch an enemy across the map if the attack is done right.

6 Just Cause 4

Chaotic Sandbox Destruction

Your comment has not been saved

Just Cause 4
7 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 68 /100 Critics Rec: 30%
Released
December 4, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Avalanche Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

In Just Cause 4 , the player takes up the role of Rico Rodriguez once again. And yes, once again, the game features destruction of epic proportions. The large, open-world sandbox map is exquisite and makes a fantastic environment for Rico to engage in the kind of over-the-top ultraviolence that he is famous for.

By using the grappling hook, the player can perform feats of super strength. The physics engine can be leveraged using the grappling hook so that the force input is magnified, producing impressive results, and allowing the player to perform crazy stunts and impressive feats of strength in Just Cause 4 .

5 The Incredible Hulk: Ultimate Destruction

Go On A Rampage As The Hulk

Your comment has not been saved

The Incredible Hulk: Ultimate Destruction
Action-Adventure
Open-World
Released
August 23, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Radical Entertainment
Platform(s)
PS2, GameCube, Xbox
Powered by

How could a game list covering super strength not include a game based on the Hulk? And The Incredible Hulk: Ultimate Destruction is the best of the bunch when it comes to games that feature this well-known Marvel character.

Super strength is the staple superpower of the Hulk, so, of course, this open-world game leans heavily on feats accomplished through sheer physical prowess. Almost everything in the environment can be smashed and destroyed, which can be a lot of fun. Tossing cars around like tennis balls, and punching down entire buildings are entirely possible in this game.

4 Marvel’s Spider-Man 2

Play As Peter Parker

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
43
8.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 88 /100 Critics Rec: 91%

October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Insomniac Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 continues the adventures of Spider-Man and Miles Morales, as they battle against new, emerging threats, including Kraven the Hunter and Venom, on a fantastic open-world map. The combat is challenging, and there are plenty of side quests and other activities such as finding collectibles.

Even though Spider-Man is best known for his web-slinging, parkouresque mode of travel, he also has a level of super strength. This superpower is used in the game for feats of strength such as lifting up vehicles, throwing enemies around, and smashing through walls.

3 Infamous: Second Son

Wield The Power Of Concrete

Your comment has not been saved

inFAMOUS Second Son
8 /10
8.2 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100 Critics Rec: 78%
Released
March 21, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Gameplay in Infamous: Second Son takes place on an open-world game map that is intended to represent Seattle in the near future. The player controls Delsin Rowe, and they have the ability to absorb other superpowers.

The interesting karma system is used to impact how powers manifest, and this includes super strength. Primarily, it is the concrete power that the player uses to perform feats of strength. Using this power, Delsin Rowe can dish out some serious melee damage to opponents, slamming them around and getting in powerful punches with his concrete-reinforced fists.

2 Saints Row 4

Crazy Open-World Gameplay

Your comment has not been saved

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.3 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 75 /100 Critics Rec: 56%
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Volition
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Saints Row 4 is one of the most haywire open-world sandbox games available. Any game that starts with the player taking on the role of the President of the United States of America, but with superpowers, sets the scene for some total chaos. The player has a range of superpowers, including super speed, telekinesis, and super strength.

The main story is fun and frolicsome, and the side quests are hilarious, verging on ridiculous at times. Using their super strength, the player can pull off some crazy moves, such as punching an enemy so hard they head up into orbit. Players who like over-the-top action will love Saints Row 4 .

1 Prototype

Chaos On An Open-World Map Of New York

Your comment has not been saved

Prototype
7 /10
Released
June 9, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Radical Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

It could be argued that the main protagonist in Prototype , Alex Mercer, is the most powerful video game character of all time. The game takes place in a nicely crafted open-world map of New York, after the Blacklight virus has begun to spread and turn people into monsters.

Alex can absorb other people, and read their memories, and also change his body into usable weapons. It is this shape-shifting ability that gives him his powers, and this includes super strength. Alex can leap very far, and smash through most obstacles that are in his way. Overall, this game gets top place on this list firstly, due to the fact Alex has such a diverse skillset, and secondly, due to the engaging storyline.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Zombies: How to Complete the Vermin Side Easter Egg
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Step 1: Acquire the Vermin Statue and Place it in the Mainframe Chamber
  • Step 2: Place the Vermin in a Microwave in the Overlook
  • Step 3: Acquire the Wunderwaffe DG-2 and Place the Vermin in Blood
  • Step 4: Use a Chopper Gunner to Shoot the Red Smoke Chimneys

Shattered Veil continues the Black Ops 6 Zombies trend with lengthy and fun side easter eggs in the maps, and while it may not be The Tomb's golden armor, it's still... interesting, to say the least. While players do not need to complete this easter egg for anything major, it's still fun to experience all the side easter eggs in Shattered Veil at least once.

For those venturing deep into Shattered Veil to uncover all the mysteries involved, this Black Ops 6 easter egg might be one to try, especially for those who reminisce on the good old days of convoluted easter eggs, which may just be a Jason Blundell reference, so here's a step-by-step guide.

Step 1: Acquire the Vermin Statue and Place it in the Mainframe Chamber

The first step for this easter egg involves players opening up the Mainframe Chamber, where Pack-a-Punch is located. Once that's been done, head through the Mainframe Chamber into the Service Tunnel, and exit left into the Supply Depot. Once players are inside the Supply Depot , turn around to face the north wall, where underneath the third grate will be a small vermin that players can interact with to pick up.

With the vermin acquired, head back to the Mainframe Chamber where, opposite the capsule that holds an Empty Canister (on the left of S.A.M.), there will be a metal dish tray that players can interact with to place the vermin. With the vermin in the tray, use any gun to shoot the test tubes and bottles on the same trolley as the tray:

  • The small far-right bottle (blue smoke)
  • The far left collection of test tubes (red smoke)
  • The bottle in the middle of both (green smoke)

Step 2: Place the Vermin in a Microwave in the Overlook

If done correctly, players will see that the vermin in the metal tray is glowing with a gas substance, and now they can interact with it to pick it up. With the vermin back in your inventory, head upstairs into the Overlook area of the Grand Foyer, where players can i nteract with any of the three microwaves found in this area:

  • West wall of the Overlook, on a table with coffee mugs
  • South east wall in the West Hallways, to the left of the wooden crate
  • South wall in the West Hallways, to the right of the green desk

Interact with one of the microwaves, which will then show the vermin placed inside. Once inside, smoke will begin to form in the microwave, and players need to pay attention as they must interact with the microwave once red smoke begins to form .

Step 3: Acquire the Wunderwaffe DG-2 and Place the Vermin in Blood

The next step is going to be perhaps the hardest, as players will need the Wunderwaffe DG-2. Considering it's not craftable, it can be a bit of a pain to get this weapon, as players will have to rely on luck by hitting the Mystery Box for 950 essence in the hopes that they get the Wunderwaffe DG-2. However, there is a side easter egg that involves getting a free and guaranteed Wunderwaffe DG-2:

With the Wunderwaffe DG-2 acquired, head back to the Mainframe Chamber, where on the right staircase leading to Pack-a-Punch, players can find a pool of blood on the floor. Interact with the blood to place the vermin , and then use the Wunderwaffe DG-2 to shoot the giant metal fan when facing north from the pool of blood.

Step 4: Use a Chopper Gunner to Shoot the Red Smoke Chimneys

Now, players need a Chopper Gunner scorestreak, which can be acquired from any Crafting Table for 2,500 Salvage once players reach Level 45. Alternatively, players will need to try and get lucky by killing Elder Disciples in the hopes they drop one.

With a Chopper Gunner acquired, activate it in the Motor Court and shoot all of the chimneys around the mansion, which will be emitting a red smoke. Once all chimneys have been destroyed, and in the next round, the map will be shrouded in fog, and Dark Aether crystals will infect the map, allowing players to collect free Salvage and equipment.

The fog change is not permanent, and will end after a few minutes, along with the Dark Aether crystals.

item.title: 8 JRPGs That Have Complicated But Great Combat Systems
item.description:
Like many genres of games, there are plenty of JRPGs out there that pride themselves on challenging players. Whether through gruesome dungeon-crawling segments, intense boss fights, or a true ending hidden behind many obscure mechanics, JRPGs that give players a challenge are almost a sub-genre in their own right, distinct from their slower-paced or narrative-focused counterparts within the same field.

Some JRPGs don't wait for the challenge to come through enemies or boss fights, however. Some games have the challenge start right from the combat menu onwards, with labyrinthine UIs or strange combat mechanics that can seem completely bizarre to the average player. Some games offer highly tactical combat options for enhanced strategy in fights, or to help immerse players in a particular role, but there are some JRPGs that simply have too much going on in the combat department. These games in particular offer some genuinely rewarding gameplay, though only once players have wrapped their head around the Byzantine combat system.

8 Resonance Of Fate

Fun, Fast-Paced Combat With A Steep Learning Curve

Your comment has not been saved

Resonance Of Fate
JRPG
Fantasy
Narrative
Systems
Released
January 28, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tri-Ace
Publisher(s)
Tri-Ace, Sega
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Developed by Tri-Ace Studios, who are known for their innovative titles, Resonance of Fate certainly brings a lot of new features to the table, and it's the perfect example of a game that's "hard to learn and hard to master" - with the upside being that once combat does click, players will be hard-pressed to find a game that has even a remotely similar combat style.

Mastering a variety of firearms, players will have to learn the difference between True Damage and Scratch Damage, as well as the effects of targeting different enemy body parts, and then get the hang of how the two different damage types differently impact the different targeted body parts on different enemies. Resonance takes a board-game approach to its gameplay, where the best way to learn is to simply do it.

7 Ogre Battle: March Of The Black Queen

A Classic JRPG, Dense In Both Narrative And Combat

Your comment has not been saved

Ogre Battle: The March Of The Black Queen
RPG
Real-Time Strategy
Systems
Released
March 12, 1993

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone
Platform(s)
SNES, Sega Saturn, PS1
Powered by

Players that do some digging can find a direct thruline from Quest Studios, to March of the Black Queen , to Square Studios, then Square Enix, and finally FF-adjacent games like Final Fantasy Tactics and Tactics Ogre . It's a bizarre rabbit hole to travel down, which is also how many would describe the combat in this classic JRPG.

This game was surprisingly ahead of its time, with a reactive open world map to traverse that had a day/night cycle, unit composition mechanics that would remain virtually unchanged through this title's spiritual successors, and a dense combination of roles, weaknesses and resistances that turn every battle into a precarious, but satisfying, balancing act.

6 Disgaea 1

Comically Intense Combat And Leveling

Disgaea 1 Complete
Strategy
RPG
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
ESRB
t

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Nippon Ichi Software
Publisher(s)
Nippon Ichi Software
Platform(s)
Switch
Powered by

Like a lot of long-running series, newer entries in the Disgaea franchise have come with a handful of quality-of-life changes and modern optimizations that have kept the core of the game the same, if a little streamlined. Disgaea in particular, with its emphasis on reaching damage of well over a million and stat levels of up to 999,999, has thankfully been free from too much simplification of its core components.

That doesn't stop Disgaea 1 from being incredibly overwhelming to players at first. Managing characters with such stupendously high stats is already tricky, but then traversing mini dungeons to upgrade weapons? Entering some characters into a new game plus mode but not all characters, while still in the first game? It certainly adds to the charm, but there are some tricky combat mechanics to master in this game.

5 Yggdra Union

An Underrated Classic Given A Great Port

Your comment has not been saved

Yggdra Union
Tactical
RPG
Strategy
Simulation
Systems
Released
March 23, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PSP, Android, iOS, Nintendo Game Boy Advance
Powered by

Many times over, players will stumble upon an unfamiliar game on Steam that seems right up their alley, only to find it has mixed or negative reviews, with players complaining about a suboptimal port from older devices to PC. Yggdra Union is an example of a port done right, with plenty of amazing QoL features implemented to a game that's practically bursting with passion and creative flare.

That flare continues into the title's combat, which is incredibly complex, but not to the point of detracting from the game, and certainly with enough depth to keep JRPG fans satisfied once they've figured out how the multi-attack system, which lets up to five units synergize their moves, functions practically.

4 Knights In The Nightmare

A Classic Among Handheld Titles

Your comment has not been saved

Knights in the Nightmare
RPG
Strategy
Shooter
Released
June 2, 2009
ESRB
T For Teen // Alcohol and Tobacco Reference, Mild Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Sting Entertainment

Publisher(s)
Sting Entertainment, Atlus
Franchise
Dept. Heaven
Platform(s)
Nintendo DS, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation Portable
Powered by

Originally released on the Nintendo DS and PSP, with the PSP version being the one that aged better, the best way to give a sense of how Knights in the Nightmare functions is to tell you that it's a three-screen game operating on a two-or-one-screen system. Shuffling between tactics, party management, and the battlefield is quite daunting, but once players get the hang of it, it's a pleasantly engaging experience.

There is a Switch port of this title, which unfortunately released only in Japan, signaling that the game's obscurity might have hindered it from getting an international release. The graphics, despite the overall theme of the game and the complex combat, actually lend the title a cozy feeling, something almost storybook-like in its nature.

3 Romancing SaGa 2

A Brilliant Remake Returning A Novel Combat System

Your comment has not been saved

Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven
JRPG
Adventure
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
October 24, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix, ArtePiazza
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

Many players might not realize just how influential the SaGa series is, with its games helping to promote many of the JRPG tropes that have become mainstays in more recent years. The combat and leveling system is quite challenging, even in the game's most recent remake, but not without its rewards.

Leveling up in individual skills instead of character levels with set stat enhancements is a far cry from what most players expect to see in a JRPG, evoking a style of game closer to The Elder Scrolls , but navigating the difficult combat encounters with this unorthodox system can lead to some incredible character builds.

2 The Last Remnant

An In-Depth, Compelling Square Enix World

Your comment has not been saved

The Last Remnant
JRPG
Systems
8.7 /10
Released
November 20, 2008
ESRB
M For Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PC, Switch, Xbox 360, PS4, Android, iOS
Powered by

Square Enix are known for their blend of sci-fi and fantasy titles, creating some of the most compelling and renowned JRPGs that the genre has ever seen. The Last Remnant , unfortunately, is not one of these, with the game having fallen somewhat into obscurity (though a Switch port does currently exist!).

The combat system was unique, and for 2008, maybe even ahead of its time, with multiple metrics for players to track and a blend of real-time and turn-based elements that would come to define many later Square Enix titles. Certainly something that takes getting used to, this game's combat system lacks the polish of Octopath Traveler or Bravely Default , but is still immensely rewarding all the same.

1 Vagrant Story

A Beautiful Story In A Well-Realized World

Your comment has not been saved

Vagrant Story
10 /10
Released
May 15, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square
Publisher(s)
Square
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

Finishing off this list with another hidden gem of a Square Enix title, Vagrant Story has a battle mode that looks more like a rendering software for early 3D animation, and is about as complicated as one too, but no other game provides an experience quite like this one.

The subtler style of storytelling and the detailed, complex character work would make up for a clunky system in its own right - but keep playing, and you'll find that clunkiness start to disappear form the real-time, omnidirectional targeting system as it starts to become a cohesive extension of the protagonist and the overall experience. Few games are as daunting to fresh JRPG players as this one, but get over the initial discomfort with the combat system, and there's a brilliant gem hiding out here.

item.title: Schedule 1: How to Pickpocket
item.description:
Making a living in Schedule 1 is quite difficult, especially in the early stages of the game. Therefore, in addition to selling goods from your home garden, you will have to find other ways of earning money. So, next, we will tell you how to pickpocket in Schedule 1 .

Pickpocketing in this illegal gardener simulator can make your life much easier. At the same time, if the players are not careful enough, they may be caught by the police or even killed by especially offended victims.

How to Pickpocket in Schedule 1

Almost all people on the streets in Schedule 1 can become your customers. You just need to let them try the goods that suit their tastes. If, for some reason, the NPC does not want to help you develop your business, then you can pickpocket them. However, it is worth noting that this is quite dangerous, so you should be very careful and stealthy when pickpocketing in Schedule 1 .

First, you must become less visible by starting to crawl. To do this, press Ctrl. This is a great way to avoid the attention of people around you, including the police, especially at night. After this, players need to find a victim. We recommend that you choose an NPC who is standing in one place in an abandoned place.

Of course, you can pickpocket moving targets, but for the first time, you should not do this. When you find a person suitable for all the conditions, go behind their back in crawl mode. As a result, you will see the option to press the E key to pickpocket in Schedule 1 .

However, this is only half the battle, as a mini-game awaits you further. Your victim can carry a lot of things in their pockets. But if they have a lock icon, then you cannot steal them. Therefore, to unlock them, you must press the space bar when the arrow moving from side to side points to a green area.

If you do everything correctly, you will be able to drag the unlocked loot into your inventory. Otherwise, you will be noticed, and the outcome can be quite different. Some NPCs will simply call the police, while others may attack you. Also, you should not hope to pickpocket the police, as this is impossible.

How to Pickpocket More Items

At the beginning of the game, you will be able to pickpocket only several items. But the higher your rank, the more green zones will appear during the mini-game. In other words, progress and earn Exp to pickpocket more in Schedule 1 .

10 Images
10 Images

Schedule I
18
8.7 /10
Released
March 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
